ISSUE OF COMMERCIAL PASSES TO HOTELS 
 
 
 
The matter regarding issue of commercial passes to representatives of 
Hotels has been reviewed.  The Federation of Hotel and Restaurant 
Associations of India has requested the Bureau to grant airport passes to its 
representatives valid for both international and domestic terminals of Indian 
airports instead of issuing separately for both the terminals. Considering the 
fact that Hotel Industry plays an important role in promotion of tourism in the 
country; reduces mal practice by touts at the airports and to remove disparity, 
the Bureau in super session of its Circular No. 20/2001 dated 7.12.2001 has 
now decided to issue commercial passes  to Hotels as  per the guidelines 
given below: - 
 
1. At Delhi,  Mumbai, Kolkata, Chennai and Bangalore,  four star 
hotels and above may each be issued with one pass per shift for all 
terminals at above airport ( i.e. 3 commercial passes valid for all the 
terminals at the above airports). 
 
2. At other airports three star hotels and above may be issued with 
one pass per shift (total three passes) valid for all terminals for 
each hotel. 
 
3. The hotels will pay cost of PIC making charges to the Bureaus and 
commercial charges as applicable to the Airports Authority of India 
according to the rules in force. 
 
4. The commercial passes will be issued for duration of one year at a 
time. 
 
5. The hotels should appoint a authorized signatory of a senior level 
functionary who will recommend issue of pass in the official hotel 
letter heads.  They will also submit the application in the prescribed 
format for commercial passes. 
 
6. The request will be cleared by the PIC Committee as per the above 
guidelines and passes will be issued by RDCOS concerned.

7. Misuse of pass by any holder for personal or unauthorized activities 
will attract penal action in addition to the hotel concerned being 
black listed. 
 
8. The pass will be valid outside the customs arrival hall in the 
international arrival and up to check-in area in the departure hall of 
international terminal. In the domestic terminal, the pass will be 
valid up to the baggage retrieval area in the arrival hall and the 
check-in area in the departure hall. 
 
9. Wherever feasible Airports Authority of India may provide one 
counter to the federation of Hotel & Restaurant Associations of 
India outside the customs arrival hall in international terminals. The 
Association 
representative 
can 
provide 
information 
to 
arriving 
tourists and help in booking accommodation etc. for those who do 
not have reservations.  This will also help those who need 
assistance for other alternative arrangements.
